article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-ZMMWgE hentry entry story-col-0

header.div: THE LIFE OF SPY BEN ZYGIER

h2.a: The Story Of Prisoner X

div.p: Ben Zygier was a zealot. Intelligent, restless, he dreamt of working for Mossad. His dream ultimately killed him.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-16SfQAa hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Overweight Man In Park Is Shockingly Good At Juggling A Soccer Ball

div.p: He had excellent control of the ball with his head much like Maradona. The great touch on his heel is similar to the likes of Ronaldinho.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-15DFmFT hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: The Economics Of Evil Google

div.p: When it comes to Google Reader, Google has been providing crucial public infrastructure — but doesn’t seem to have an interest in maintaining that infrastructure.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-11laR7c hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Joseph Gordon-Levitt Was Very Enthusiastic On 'Jeopardy' In 1997

div.p: Joey went on Celebrity Jeopardy and was VERY excited. His opponents were Kirsten Dunst and that kid from The Nanny.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YKWlSs hentry entry story-col-1

header.div: HAVE YOU HEARD OF A QUINTILLION?

h2.a: Why Your March Madness Bracket Sucks Explained By Math

div.p: Good luck getting every team right! (No, seriously. You need the luck.)

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-WOEzBl hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: The Single Characteristic That Shapes Gun Deaths More Than Anything Else

div.p: Gun deaths are shaped by race in America. Whites are far more likely to shoot themselves, and African Americans are far more likely to be shot by someone else.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-14h5OJ3 hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Golfer Decides To Hit A Ball Out Of A Tree

div.p: Sergio Garcia hit his ball into a tree on No. 10 at Bay Hill on Sunday. The logical thing to do when you're Sergio Garcia? Climb the tree and hit it, of course.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-WOAFZ3 hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Placebo Effect Produces Higher Test Scores

div.p: The belief that you have access to the answers makes it more likely you will get them right.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YA0YQc hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: How To Get That Annoying Song Out Of Your Head According To Science

div.p: They are the songs you cannot get out of your head. Now scientists may have found a way to help anyone plagued by those annoying tunes that lodge themselves inside our heads and repeat on an endless loop.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-XzVkNU hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Lewis Hamilton Forgets Which Team He's On And Goes To Wrong Pit Stop

div.p: Lewis Hamilton forgot that he doesn't drive for McLaren anymore and went to the wrong pit stop.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-ZlaKoG hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Photographer Narrowly Avoids The Jaws Of A Hungry Crocodile

div.p: Here’s a pro tip: if you ever find yourself with a strong desire to photograph crocodiles in their natural habitat, don’t do it like the photographer in the video above (warning: it contains a bit of strong language).

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-WKFanz hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: Tea Partiers Boycotting Fox News For Not Being Conservative Enough

div.p: First it was the ‘left’ turn after the election, then Benghazi coverup accusations. Activists have a list of demands for the conservative network, which some say is ‘not as fair and balanced as I thought.’

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-Y2WU0z hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: North Korea Allegedly Ordered Some Of Its Diplomats To Become Drug Dealers

div.p: North Korea sent a large amount of illegal drugs to its embassy in an East European country last December and ordered diplomats there to sell it for cash by early April, a diplomatic source here claims.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-ZZuYVN hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: The Startling Rise Of Disability In America

div.p: In the past 30 years, the number of Americans who are on disability has skyrocketed. The rise has come even as medical advances have allowed many more people to remain on the job, and new laws have banned workplace discrimination against the disabled.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-WOwAEv hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: The Mystery Of Glass Exploding At 130,000 FPS

div.p: Here's a really neat video looking at the unusual qualities of Prince Rupert's Drop.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YkGwss hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Florida Passes Bill Banning Internet Cafes

div.p: Internet cafes across the state could soon be forced to close their doors.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YKCqDs hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Why Does The U.S. Navy Still Own Wooden-Hulled Warships?

div.p: Everyone likes a real wood deck.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-X3OyFl hentry entry story-col-2

header.div: SO WE CAN WATCH BRACKETS DISINTEGRATE

h2.a: Why Do We Play Games?

div.p: Why do humans play sports?

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-XwZlCA hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: The Dwarves Of Auschwitz

div.p: The story of a family of dwarves snatched from the gas chamber by Josef Mengele himself sounded incredible. But how to verify the testimony of Holocaust survivors? And should you even try?

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-11wPCTE hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: IRS Uses Tax Money For 'Star Trek' Spoof

div.p: It appears there’s no sign of intelligent life at the Internal Revenue Service. They created Star Trek and Gilligan’s Island spoofs that cost tax payers $60,000.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-1659Typ hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: Russia's Rich Use Ambulances To Avoid Traffic Jams

div.p: Police in Moscow are to carry out checks on ambulances after reports that emergency vehicles have been fitted with plush interiors and are being rented out to VIP commuters hoping to dodge the city’s appalling traffic jams.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-Yyjett hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: The Brains Of The Animal Kingdom

div.p: New research shows that we have grossly underestimated both the scope and the scale of animal intelligence. Primatologist Frans de Waal on memory-champ chimps, tool-using elephants and rats capable of empathy.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-X2v4kr hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Most Shocking Thing About Canada's Chemical Valley? People Live There

div.p: Collectively forming a post-human landscape, more than 60 oil refineries and petro-chemical plants—40 percent of Canada’s total chemical industry—operate within 15 miles of the valley.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YlCQXl hentry entry story-col-2

header.div: ONE GLASS IS OVER THE LIMIT

h2.a: Lawmakers Seek To Ban Google Glass On The Road

div.p: West Virginia lawmakers are already pouncing on the existence of Google Glass and introducing a bill that would prohibit drivers from making a spectacle of themselves.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-11qilpm hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Major Security Hole Allowed Apple Passwords To Be Reset With Only Email Address And Date Of Birth

div.p: Apple rolled out two-step verification, a security measure that promises to further shield Apple ID and iCloud accounts from being hijacked. Unfortunately, a new exploit was discovered that affected all customers who hadn't yet enabled the new feature.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-11uCRZP hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: If 'Star Wars' Was Dubbed With 'Jurassic Park'

div.p: You know you would see this movie.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10xzUVB hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: Are We Too Naive About Where We're Putting Our Data?

div.p: Maybe we’re too caught up in ever-changing trends to have a moment to stop and think about the digital wake we create or what responsibility it is of anyone to manage it.
